news.Press_News_Content:
Your Birthday?
Once a year in July – cards and presents can be sent to my home address.
Your First Break in the Music Scene?
I have been actively promoting my music via the internet for about 6 months now with my own webpage and was noticed by a lady here in Australia called Floreena who emailed me and asked if she could play my music on the radio station she works for. Floreena gave me some very good advise on how to market myself and pretty soon I had radio stations from around the globe emailing me for interviews about my music. ArtistAloud.com approached me about 4 months ago after I joined their fantastic site and uploaded a song. They liked what they heard and the rest is history. I am extremely grateful for the opportunity to be part of the ArtistAloud.com phenomenon.
What do you believe is the USP in your style of music?
My Unique Selling Point - would be my voice and my own style. I don’t try to imitate anyone and tend not to go with something that is trendy just because others are doing it.
How do you believe music should be consumed?
Nothing can beat listening to an artist live! In this day and age though I believe the internet is definitely the way to go and this platform exposes people to original music that they possibly would not hear on radio/tv.
Who do you see connecting to your music?
Definitely country music fans. I have tried different styles but always come back to that country sound.
Why did you decide to take the digital route to release your music?
The internet makes things easier and faster for artists especially with regards to building a fan-base online. I have spent the last 6 months plugging my website on line through social media such as Facebook, Twitter, My Space, Bebo and the likes. Also YouTube has also been a fantastic tool for promoting my music. I am not at all technically minded – I just love to sing – but I have learned to use the internet to my advantage and it has worked! If I can do it, anyone can.
Where do you think the music industry is going? Do you believe that there is a market for non-film music in India?
The music industry is cyclic and I think we are heading towards a revival of the 50’s/60’s style.
Definitely a market for non-film music in India. I have noticed that a lot of mainstream music coming out of America and Europe lately has that “Bollywood” feel and drive behind it. Indian music is definitely influencing a lot of artists.
Can you say a few words about each of the songs you have on board ArtistAloud.com?
My song – Country Yodeling Hoedown Girl – was written from the heart. I was really struggling for inspiration and my young daughter, Alison, said to me – “write about what you love.” I thought – “why didn’t I think of that!” This song took me all of about 15 minutes to pen and put to music and has won numerous songwriting awards in New Zealand over the years but I never took it any further until now. It is very dear to my heart.
If not a singer what else would you have been?
Definitely an actress. I grew up loving the stage, the lights, and the makeup, everything about it. My Mum and Dad performed in many musical theatre productions and I definitely inherited my love of the stage from them. I remember auditioning for a production of Cinderella when I was about 14. I was shortlisted for the lead role with another girl and it all came down to who was the better singer. I got the part and I think at that moment I decided that maybe singing was my forte.
Your favorites
Singers – Cilla Black, Lou Lou, Dusty Springfield, Dolly Parton, Nat King Cole.
Musicians – John Denver, The Eagles, CCR.
Songs – I have so many favorites and it is so hard to choose – Peaceful Easy Feeling by the Eagles is one I could listen to over and over again.
Your strengths and your weakness?
I am very very persistent and driven so I guess that is one of my strengths along with being very resourceful! Weaknesses – definitely chocolate!!
You Idolize, Why?
Hmmm this is a tough one – when I was 15 it was Donny Osmond but then he got married and that changed everything. At the moment I hold Taylor Swift in pretty high esteem – someone so young who is so talented with her songwriting and performance.
Your Inspiration or Mentor?
I worked with an amazing vocalist, Sue Murphy, years ago and she was truly inspirational. I learnt a lot from Sue about performance, self assurance and confidence.
Your Most Prized Possession?
Family photos & videos - family is everything in my world and they matter the most.
Your Favorite Quote?
Where there is a will there is a way.
Your Trademark?
My yodeling – whenever I perform people always request a yodel. These days there are not too many people out there yodeling – especially in Australasia. It does not matter what sort of crowd I am performing in front of, the yodel is appreciated.
Any social cause close to your heart?
Protecting children from those who would hurt or exploit them.
Singing to you is?
Like breathing. I just cannot imagine not being able to sing. When I am 95 I will have my walking frame up on that stage with me!! I will die singing a tune.
Your message to budding singers.
Blow your own trumpet, promote anywhere you can, sing anywhere you can, enter competitions to get noticed, use the internet – especially social networks. Most of all never give up – and don’t let anybody tell you that you wont be a singer. Hold onto your dreams and follow them.
On ArtistAloud.com
The staff at ArtistAloud.com are just fantastic to work with. They are very supportive and in touch with the latest technology and innovations. I am excited at the opportunities ArtistAloud.com has offered me and extra excited that I will make new friends and maybe gather a few fans in India.

Press_News_Featured.p:
Why did you decide to take the digital route to release your music?
The internet makes things easier and faster for artists especially with regards to building a fan-base online. I have spent the last 6 months plugging my website on line through social media such as Facebook, Twitter, My Space, Bebo and the likes. Also YouTube has also been a fantastic tool for promoting my music. I am not at all technically minded – I just love to sing – but I have learned to use the internet to my advantage and it has worked! If I can do it, anyone can.

Can you say a few words about each of the songs you have on board ArtistAloud.com?
My song – Country Yodeling Hoedown Girl – was written from the heart. I was really struggling for inspiration and my young daughter, Alison, said to me – “write about what you love.” I thought – “why didn’t I think of that!” This song took me all of about 15 minutes to pen and put to music and has won numerous songwriting awards in New Zealand over the years but I never took it any further until now. It is very dear to my heart.

Your message to budding singers.
Blow your own trumpet, promote anywhere you can, sing anywhere you can, enter competitions to get noticed, use the internet – especially social networks. Most of all never give up – and don’t let anybody tell you that you wont be a singer. Hold onto your dreams and follow them.

news.Press_News_Exclusive:
On ArtistAloud.com
The staff at ArtistAloud.com are just fantastic to work with. They are very supportive and in touch with the latest technology and innovations. I am excited at the opportunities ArtistAloud.com has offered me and extra excited that I will make new friends and maybe gather a few fans in India.

news.Press_News_Content:
Your Birthday’s?
Chandrahaas- 4th August.
Uvais- 4th August.
Madhur- 23rd September.
Your First Break in the Music Scene?
First year of college, we got a chance to open for our Battle of Bands. People loved us as much as the main acts. Though we didn’t practice much, our song selection was crazy. And yeah, we became THE favorite lately.
What do you believe is the USP in your style and music?
LYRICS.CORRECT EXPRESSION.IMAGERY.PERIOD.
How do you believe music should be consumed?
We think…let the music consume you. It is awesome to surrender to the right song at the right time.
Who do you see connecting to your music?
Our music is full of innocence. Often songs result in extreme of emotions. We are trying to achieve a midway.
People who listen to us are mostly seeking this bridge of emotions. Our major goal is to express correctly. People who know their emotions correctly get connected to our music in first shot. Others live with them to know them more.
How did you guys come together as a Band?
We all were hard core GnR fans. So, the guys with similar taste buds ended up on the same dinner table and started eating together.
Why did you decide to take the digital route to release your music?
Coz we have seen friends around us, downloading lots of digital media. The days of buying CD’s are going vintage. And its quick and interesting too. We also get to know how people react to our songs (through comments), which is one major drawback of the traditional distribution.
Where do you think the music industry is going? Do you believe that there is a market for non-film music in India?
Frankly, we are too young and fresh to comment on the whole industry. But we do believe that people have become more open to local talent and they do cherish good songs regardless of the origin.
Can you say a few words about each of the songs you have on board ArtistAloud.com?
Right now we have only one song onboard –“Roothe”.
A lot of relationships fail because the people involved don’t express how much they need and want the other. This song just expresses that value. “Tu mujhse na roothe kabhi chahe roothe sab sansaar”.
We took less than three days to compose and record “Roothe”. And we are really proud of this song. :)
If not a Composer’s or singer’s what else you would have been?
Really hard to imagine. Naad has been a big part of our lives and all we are sure of is we would have been great friends planning to make a band. :)
Your Favorites
Singers: Nusrat Fateh Khan, Freddie Mercury.
Musicians: Pink Floyd, Guns & Roses, Aerosmith, Queen, RHCP, Kailasa, Junoon.
Songs: WALL.
Your strengths and your weakness?
Our strength is the understanding and comfort we share, which our music reflects too. We are plain, simple guys with moderate musical goals. This makes it easy to compose as we are never in self-imposed-pressure.
Weakness: We lack formal musical training..and we are working on it
You Idolize, Why?
Pink Floyd: for the soundscapes they left for us to roam around.
Your Inspiration or Mentor?
We had awesome seniors in college who taught us big and small issues of playing music. Playing with them and their confidence on us has been the biggest inspiration.
And ya…evry “like” or “download” on webpages inspires us to make more stuff. Thank you everyone who gave us a chance to play.
Your most prized possession?
Our First Song : ” Dekhte Dekhte”.
Your Favorite Quote?
“God listens to silence, We are a little louder”.
Your Trademark?
Warm Guitar Solos on top of Ambient Acoustic Arpeggios.
Any social cause close to your heart?
Our Vocalist is associated with a Social Project “Daughters of God” which talks about economic acceptance of transgenders in India.
As a band, Naad is not into any social cause, currently.
Singing to you is?
A life long learning process. A way to channelize emotions and a place to find joy.
Your message to budding singers (to make a mark in the industry)?
As a co learner I really want to put this message:
“ Voice is very precious. Use it carefully”.
Also please give a few lines about ArtistAloud.com.
We think artistAloud has given us what we always wished. A funky, classy and distributed platform to spread our music. Its nice to see our song as a promising product. Thank you guys.

Coz we have seen friends around us, downloading lots of digital media. The days of buying CD’s are going vintage. And its quick and interesting too. We also get to know how people react to our songs (through comments), which is one major drawback of the traditional distribution.

Can you say a few words about each of the songs you have on board ArtistAloud.com?
Right now we have only one song onboard –“Roothe”.
A lot of relationships fail because the people involved don’t express how much they need and want the other. This song just expresses that value. “Tu mujhse na roothe kabhi chahe roothe sab sansaar”.
We took less than three days to compose and record “Roothe”. And we are really proud of this song. :)

news.Press_News_Content:
Your Birthday?
26.01.1967
Your First Break in the Music Scene?
Winning the “Lata Mangeshkar Trophy” for the best male singer of India in “Meri Awaz Suno-1996”- The first televised national level music reality show.
What do you believe is the USP in your style and music?
My Voice, modulations and my ability to sing in any language.
How do you believe music should be consumed?
If there is passion and variety in what one offers, music will be consumed with all delight.
Who do you see connecting to your music?
The young and the old alike who love quality music.
Why did you decide to take the digital route to release your music?
It has worldwide reach and response is instant. The content can also be upgraded as per the feedback.
Where do you think the music industry is going? Do you believe that there is a market for non-film music in India?
Yes, music is slowly getting separated from films and when people are looking on for alternate ways to hear quality music without being forced by the routine film music, the internet is the right medium for getting it across the audience across the world. Internet is the present and future of music industry.
Can you say a few words about each of the songs you have on board ArtistAloud.com?
This is my own composition and very close to my heart. A slow melody that has the fragrance of love all the way.
If not a singer what else you would have been?
Can’t think of me donning any other role as of now.
Your Favorites?
I am a lover of good music and by good music I mean every form of music across the world. So I cannot selectively pick Singers, Musicians and Songs as this page would not be enough for that. Every great musician and music has an individuality that makes us listen to them. I listen to every kind of music from film songs(old and new), classical music (Western, Carnatic and Hindustani), Hollywood film background music, folk music, jazz, blues, rock, Greek, Japanese, Chinese, African, Arabic etc.
Your strengths and your weakness?
My strengths are that I have a sound base in classical music and can easily adapt to any style of singing. I also have a voice that has a very good range. My main weakness is that I do not know how to market myself as others do.
You Idolize, Why?
Idols are the ones who inspire you to emulate them. Take the positive aspects of every idol and develop your own style in the longer run.
Your Inspiration or Mentor?
Inspirations: K.J Yesudas, Mohammad Rafi, Kishore Kumar and Mukesh.
Mentor: Raveendran (Malayalm Film Music Director).
Your most prized possession?
My Vocal Chords.
Your Favorite Quote?
Live in the present moment as the present moment is inevitable.
Your Trademark?
Meri Awaz Suno.
Any social cause close to your heart?
Healing the mind and body through Music.
Singing to you is?
A Passion
Your message to budding singers (to make a mark in the industry)?
No short cuts, only hard work can sustain you in the long run.
Also please give a few lines about ArtistAloud.com?
A tremendous and unique platform for all professional and amateur musicians alike to promote their music without the hassles of middle men who make you run from pillar to post in your efforts to promote your talent.

Press_News_Featured.p:
Why did you decide to take the digital route to release your music?
It has worldwide reach and response is instant. The content can also be upgraded as per the feedback.

Can you say a few words about each of the songs you have on board ArtistAloud.com?
This is my own composition and very close to my heart. A slow melody that has the fragrance of love all the way.

Your message to budding singers (to make a mark in the industry)?
No short cuts, only hard work can sustain you in the long run.

news.Press_News_Exclusive:
Give a few lines about ArtistAloud.com.
A tremendous and unique platform for all professional and amateur musicians alike to promote their music without the hassles of middle men who make you run from pillar to post in your efforts to promote your talent.

news.Press_News_Content:
Your birthday’s?
Nishant Nair: 18-04-1983.
Pulkit Rangwani: 16-11-1987.
Renfred D’Souza: 09-07-1984.
Your first break in the music scene?
That would be ArtistAloud.com itself.
What do you believe is the USP in your style and music?
Our USP is that we don’t restrict ourselves to a particular genre, thereby having compositions that distinctly vary from each other.
How do you believe music should be consumed?
We believe each one to his own but talking from personal experience, nothing works like hunting for music online. Also, music should be taken as a medium to enrich oneself.
Who do you see connecting to your music?
Our music has certain freshness to it, based on our philosophies of life. Those looking for a slice of life in music – be it a take on love, breaking free, peace or aspirations will be able to relate to our compositions.
How did you guys come together as a band?
Destiny! We are part of a digital marketing company and our love for music thickened our bond.
Why did you decide to take the digital route to release your music?
Being part of the digital marketing industry, we know the potential of the medium. We are confident of its capability and we sincerely believe that it is where the future of the entertainment industry lies.
Where do you think the music industry is going? Do you believe that there is a market for non-film music in India?
The industry has always made its presence felt. And it will only peak from its present status. Non-film music has a niche audience, and only because it has a limited reach due to unavailability of enough promotional mediums.
Can you say a few words about each of the songs you have on board ArtistAloud.com?
Faasle, currently the only number with ArtistAloud.com is a nostalgic love song that is catchy and hummable.
If not composer’s or singer’s what else would you have been?
Music always was and still is our passion. We would always be associated with it in some form or the other.
Your favourites:
Singers/ Musicians/ Songs:
Jheel pe jaise/ Sunte hi rehte/ Rehne de/ Aap par arz hai – all by Lucky Ali.
Soldier of fortune/ Black night – Deep Purple.
Kaise gaun main/ Dil nahi lag raha/ Jaane tu -- by Junoon.
Riders on the storm/ Alabama song – by The Doors.
All apologies/ In bloom – Nirvana.
Your strengths and your weakness?
We have the strength and potential to create good and different music. However, lack of enough resources to enhance our music is a bane!
You idolize, why?
Lucky Ali. His songs have thought provoking lyrics and he has a soulful voice, which conveys emotions like no other. And of course, his music is simply amazing!
Your inspiration or mentor?
Our music inspires us in every aspect of life!
You’re most prized possession?
All that a Master Card can’t buy! ?
Your favourite quote?
As Friedrich Nietzsche would say: Without music, life would be a mistake.
Your trademark?
We’re hoping that will be our handsome faces ;-)
Any social cause close to your heart?
Anything to help needy children.
Singing to you is?
Shooting straight from the heart!
Your message to budding singers (to make a mark in the industry)?
If it is meant to be, it will be. Just follow your passion!
Also please give a few lines about ArtistAloud.com
Kudos to ArtistAloud.com for giving non-film musicians a platform to make their talent known to the world. We’re sure it will be a witness to a lot of success stories in the days to come. Cheers!

Press_News_Featured.p:
Why did you decide to take the digital route to release your music?
Being part of the digital marketing industry, we know the potential of the medium. We are confident of its capability and we sincerely believe that it is where the future of the entertainment industry lies.

Can you say a few words about each of the songs you have on board ArtistAloud.com?
Faasle, currently the only number with ArtistAloud.com is a nostalgic love song that is catchy and hummable.

Your message to budding singers (to make a mark in the industry)?
If it is meant to be, it will be. Just follow your passion!

news.Press_News_Exclusive:
Give a few lines about ArtistAloud.com
Kudos to ArtistAloud.com for giving non-film musicians a platform to make their talent known to the world. We’re sure it will be a witness to a lot of success stories in the days to come. Cheers!

news.Press_News_Content:
Your Birthday?
Mahesh Matkar – 20th June 1988.
Rakesh Kharvi – 16th June 1981.
Your First Break in the Music Scene?
ArtisitAloud.com – Obviously the BEST. Can we get a better break than this…!
What do you believe is the USP in your style and music?
Our music is in a way very catchy… if someone listens to our music ones, the person will remember it at least throughout the day. It catches people’s minds very soon and so we are Muziminds..!
How do you believe music should be consumed?
Music is the BEST way to express yourself to someone. Your feelings that you can’t express in words can very easily be expressed through music.
Who do you see connecting to your music?
Our mind and my listeners’ minds.
Why did you decide to take the digital route to release your music?
Because ArtistAloud.com is the platform that can let us spread our talent throughout the globe. We can connect to most of the music lovers globally.
Where do you think the music industry is going? Do you believe that there is a market for non-film music in India?
Music industry has taken a very long jump into national and also global market. There is no human being alive that will not get connected to music somewhere somehow in its life and so music filmy or non-filmy, it doesn’t matter. Music is music, it will surely get connected to the one who wants to get connected to it.
Can you say a few words about each of the songs you have on board ArtistAloud.com?
We have our first entry on ArtistAloud.com viz., Jeena Nahi.
This one is a Romantic Song wherein the Guy has been denied by the Girl for marriage. It’s not that the Girl is not in love with him, it’s just because her parents are forcing her to do so. But, the Guy is unaware of the same and he thinks that she has betrayed him and sings this song with an isolated and a heart filled with sorrow and depression.
If not a singer what else you would have been?
We are not Singers, we are musicians and composers here. We love to write music, compose music, listen to music but we don’t sing. And so if not a Musician / Composer, we would have been stupidly serving at some stupid office.
Your Favorites
Singers – Lucky Ali and Sonu Nigam
Musicians – A. R. Rehman
Songs – Deewana (Sonu Nigam) and Sunoh (Lucky Ali)
Your strengths and your weakness?
Strengths – Composing any kind of Music.
Weakness – We can’t lie AND Music – We can’t stay alive without it.
You Idolize, Why?
A.R. Rehman – Because his compositions are different and can be vividly distinguished from any other composer in the industry.
Your Inspiration or Mentor?
Somu Seal – He is industry’s leading guitarist, music arranger and our MENTOR.
Your most prized possession?
Being live on ArtistAloud.com.
Your Favorite Quote?
After every storm, the SUN returns..!
Your Trademark?
MuziMinds – Super Talented Artists with Musical Minds..!
Any social cause close to your heart?
Have done a lot but nothing so close to our heart yet.
Singing to you is?
No singing but music composition for us means “Life”.
Your message to budding singers (to make a mark in the industry)?
Our message to all the composers: “We have entered on ArtistAloud.com, beware, people are gonna stop clicking any others than us..!”
Also please give a few lines about ArtistAloud.com.
ArtistAloud.com seems to be the BEST platform for all musicians to showcase their talent to the world. We are very thankful to each and everyone at ArtistAloud.com who have made this platform available to us and much more hidden talent like us who are desperate to showcase their musical talent to all..!

Why did you decide to take the digital route to release your music?
Because ArtistAloud.com is the platform that can let us spread our talent throughout the globe. We can connect to most of the music lovers globally.

Can you say a few words about each of the songs you have on board ArtistAloud.com?
We have our first entry on ArtistAloud.com viz., Jeena Nahi.
This one is a Romantic Song wherein the Guy has been denied by the Girl for marriage. It’s not that the Girl is not in love with him, it’s just because her parents are forcing her to do so. But, the Guy is unaware of the same and he thinks that she has betrayed him and sings this song with an isolated and a heart filled with sorrow and depression.

Your message to budding singers (to make a mark in the industry)?
Our message to all the composers: “We have entered on ArtistAloud.com, beware, people are gonna stop clicking any others than us..!”

We are very thankful to each and everyone at ArtistAloud.com who have made this platform available to us and much more hidden talent like us who are desperate to showcase their musical talent to all..!

news.Press_News_Content:
Your Birthday?
January – sorry, unwilling to share any more details.
Your First Break in the Music Scene?
I haven’t got a break yet. My debut Bengali album, Jolchobi, is ready – it needs a break from a label to get it out to music lovers in India.
What do you believe is the USP in your style and music?
Exciting guitar solos, intricate music arrangement, vocal harmonies, poetry in lyrics, and a unique voice which can be remembered once heard.
How do you believe music should be consumed?
Music should be consumed with involvement. When listening to a song, the listener should try to appreciate the many elements which go into making that particular song sound good – the music arrangement, the various instruments playing in it etc., and also try to attach emotionally to it.
Who do you see connecting to your music?
People who have a good ear for appreciating the various elements in a song, such as the guitars, bass, percussions, harmonies, arrangements etc, will definitely appreciate my music. Also, my music should do well with people who like to experience different flavors, and combinations, of music.
Why did you decide to take the digital route to release your music?
This is the internet generation – everybody uses the internet in some way or the other – so, a digital route seems to be the best way of getting one’s music across to all parts of the world.
Where do you think the music industry is going? Do you believe that there is a market for non-film music in India?
The music industry is innovating a lot, especially in film music. There is a great effort towards collaborations across various music trends – Indian classical, Sufi, Blues, Rocks, Pop etc. However, I think most Indian music lovers still listen to music only coming from films. There definitely is a market for non-film music, but it’s difficult to reach that music to the music lovers. Here, ArtistAloud.com has a big role to play!
Can you say a few words about each of the songs you have on board ArtistAloud.com?
Well, my intro video has clippings from a song called “Megh Chara Brishti”, which is one of the songs from my debut Bengali album, called Jolchobi. It’s a rock type numbers with some touches of Indian classical fusion and some great guitar solos. The other song on board is “Kemon Hoto”, which talks about utopia. The third one is called “Barish” – it’s a Hindi song (with a home made music video too!). It’s a bit melancholic song, but with an upbeat rhythm.
If not a singer what else you would have been?
Well, singing is not my profession – I am computer scientist by profession. But yes, if this had not been my passion, I would love to be novel writer!
Your Favorites
Singers: Lata Mangeshkar, Kishore Kumar
Musicians: A.R.Rahman, the Beatles, Eric Clapton, Mark Knopfler, Hans Zimmer, R.D Barman, S.D. Barman, Salil Chowdhury, Suman Chattopadhyay.
Songs: “Anondo Dhara” – a song composed by Rabindranath Tagore.
Your strengths and your weakness?
Strengths: Whatever I do, I try to put in my best efforts and try to be creative about it.
Weakness: Laziness overcomes me sometimes, and I end up not being able to do some things which I would like to see get done!
You Idolize, Why?
Sachin Tendulkar. Because he excels in what he is passionate about, has reached dizzy heights of fame by doing what he loves, yet is rooted and humble.
Your Inspiration or Mentor?
My family.
Your most prized possession?
My family.
Your Trademark?
Beard and mustache – the so called “Bengali Poet” look :)
Any social cause close to your heart?
Free education for every poor kid who cannot afford education.
Singing to you is?
A passion.
Your message to budding singers (to make a mark in the industry)?
I am not sure I am eligible yet to advise budding musicians, but in general, I guess its one thing to be passionate about something, but working hard to perfect it is the most important thing.
Also please give a few lines about ArtistAloud.com.
ArtistAloud.com will surely bring in the digital revolution that is required to make non-film music from lesser known artists reach out to people all over the world. It’s already done a fantastic job in showcasing profiles from many talented musicians, who would otherwise have remained anonymous. At the same time, I see many established musicians on ArtistAloud.com, which goes on to show that it’s indeed becoming a serious forum for avid music lovers as well as music creators.

Press_News_Featured.p:
Why did you decide to take the digital route to release your music?
This is the internet generation – everybody uses the internet in some way or the other – so, a digital route seems to be the best way of getting one’s music across to all parts of the world.

Can you say a few words about each of the songs you have on board ArtistAloud.com?
Well, my intro video has clippings from a song called “Megh Chara Brishti”, which is one of the songs from my debut Bengali album, called Jolchobi. It’s a rock type numbers with some touches of Indian classical fusion and some great guitar solos. The other song on board is “Kemon Hoto”, which talks about utopia. The third one is called “Barish” – it’s a Hindi song (with a home made music video too!). It’s a bit melancholic song, but with an upbeat rhythm.

Your message to budding singers (to make a mark in the industry)?
I am not sure I am eligible yet to advise budding musicians, but in general, I guess its one thing to be passionate about something, but working hard to perfect it is the most important thing.

news.Press_News_Exclusive:

ArtistAloud.com will surely bring in the digital revolution that is required to make non-film music from lesser known artists reach out to people all over the world. It’s already done a fantastic job in showcasing profiles from many talented musicians, who would otherwise have remained anonymous. At the same time, I see many established musicians on ArtistAloud.com, which goes on to show that it’s indeed becoming a serious forum for avid music lovers as well as music creators.

Press_News_Content.span: ArtistAloud.com, the platform for independent musicians by Hungama Digital Media, has won the ?IndiaSocial Case Challenge 2? for the ?Best Strategic Programme?.

news.Press_News_Exclusive: abc

news.Press_News_Content:
ArtistAloud.com offers DRM (digital rights management)-free music at Rs 10 a piece. One can also download four songs at Rs 20. The songs are made available in mp3 format, for both PC and mobile devices. The website currently features songs spanning over six genres which range from alternative pop, classic Indi-pop, fusion, English rock, Hindi rock and Bollywood pop.
The ArtistAloud music library can also be accessed through Hungama?s domestic and international digital distribution partnerships comprising, mobile operators, Hungama.com, the BSNL storefront, iTunes, Rhapsody, Amazon MP3, and through the Tata Sky DTH platform.
Neeraj Roy, MD and CEO, Hungama Digital Media, has said, ?Hungama?s new initiative, ArtistAloud.com, combines the possibilities of digital platform with great musical talent. It rests on two pillars -- giving each artist his freedom of expression and music lovers their right to choose from a wider offering.?
?Today, nobody supports or promotes the independent artiste and as a consequence good talent suffers. I am extremely happy that ArtistAloud.com is supporting and giving them a platform for promotion and I give them my aashirvaad wholeheartedly,? Asha Bhosle, a Bollywood playback singer, has said.
Shaan, another Bollywood playback singer, has added, ?I appreciate the (ArtistAloud.com) effort as it aims to help independent musicians and music businesses thrive in the changing media environment. Importantly, the musician can directly connect with its audience without the mercy of any music company.?
news.Press_News_Exclusive: asa

Press_News_Content.p: Riding high on the warm reviews of their first two stage performances the band is all set to launch their first album online. Ek Ladki?, Tere Bina? and Tandav their first few compositions would be now available on the mouse click.

br.br: Last month the band made performed at the Acharya Atre auditorium and the Subhedarwada ground. ?Suburbs are prepared to absorb pure rock. We have begun with fusion wherein we serve the audience with rock in a desi platter,? said Mayuresh Kelkar composer-cum-guitarist of the band. He however assures that one can expect some real head-banging material from the troupe in the New Year.

Press_News_Content.p: Nestled in the calm locales of Godrej Hill is their newly opened digital studio. It is therefore not surprising when Ashish Tiwari, support vocalist and lead singer for QUE tracks claims that their music is inspired from nature. ?This very inspiration helped in naming the band,? adds Tiwari. Dhwani signifies sound. ?Dhwani stands for sound that connects body, mind and soul,? he further explains.

Interestingly, the troupe also plans to go mobile on their music. Ringtones of the first album will also be available on the web. ?A ringtone is the best way to cater to a niche audience. Every phone call can spread our music amongst people,? added Kelkar. Meanwhile, these young musicians also have to face the music of a strict 9-5 work schedule, sometimes even more erratic. ?Our jobs keep us occupied throughout the week.

Weekends are exclusively for music,? chuckles Kelkar. He further adds, ?We work for the stomach and jam for peace?. Busy switching to the soft rock and classical opt Kelkar feels that the band has ideal balance to change suburban rock culture.

Chandrashekhar the lead vocalist, also heard on All India Radio (A.I.R) is the dark horse of the troupe. Ashish accompanies him with vocals while Snehal (Tabla), Bipin (Drum) and Mangesh (guitarist) make the ideal recipe for some peppy soul-stirring music.

p.br: On the quest for the young suburban rocker for couple of years, the band wants to bring rock in the mainstream music gallery.

news.Press_News_Exclusive: bbb

p.strong: OF late, it?s been raining reality shows. So, why another story on the finalists of a singing contest?

br.p: Well, simply because Chhote Ustaad is the only show where two girls have made it to the finals. Bubbling with fizzy endorphins on their feat, we catch hold of the two lil? girls and quiz them about their love for singing, dreams and women power!

Their initial inaccessibility for a telephonic interview is, no doubt, irksome. However, our ?stars-in-the-making? have quite a ?spring in their voices? when they finally greet us over the phone. It?s perhaps their chirpy eagerness to make it big, which lets all irritation melt away.
And so we throw a clich?d volley of queries at Aishwarya Majmudar, busy rehearsing for Chhote Ustaad?s grand finale on Saturday.

Aishwarya seems particularly delighted because of her favourite Amitabh Bachchan?s presence at the recently shot promo shoot for the finals. ?Amit uncle?s too cute! He noticed that I was wearing a shirt too large for my size and immediately adjusted my collar, saying Ye mera shirt aapko kisne de diya.?

Jokes apart, their mommies-in-tow have been quite a support system post the grilling rounds. Says Aishwarya Majmudar, ?I?m not tensed about studies. My school in Ahmedabad has already promoted me to class X. But yes, a lot of hardwork is involved for this contest too.

We are doing five hours of riyaaz daily, besides a 2-3 hour choreography class and shoots. I guess it?s the price for success! With sparkling confidence, moms-in-tow and well-rehearsed statements, these girls seem lil? stars indeed. Maybe, Big B wasn?t exactly joking when he whispered to the show?s camera person ?These are stars of today, hum to junior artist hain.?
